description: Installation of one front dormer window; alterations to rear dormer windows; single storey rear extension (following demolition of rear conservatory extension at ground floor) incorporating a raised terrace; provision of associated cycle storage facilities; replacement of windows and doors; alterations to internal walls (Listed Building Consent)
decision_conditions: The development to which this consent relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date on which the consent is granted.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of Section 18(1) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990, as amended, to prevent the accumulation of unimplemented listed building consents and to enable the Local Planning Authority to review the situation at the end of this period if the development has not begun. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): A702/L1 Location Plan; A702/PM01 Existing Ground and First Floor Plans; A702/PM02 Existing Second Floor and Third Floor Plans; A702/PM03 Existing Front and North Side Elevations; A702/PM04 Existing Rear and South Side Elevations; A702/PM05 Rev B Existing Sections; A702/PM06 Existing Roof and Garden Plan; A702/PL01 Rev D Proposed Ground and First Floor Plans; A702/PL02 Rev B Proposed Second and Third Floor Plans; A702/PL03 Rev C Proposed Front and North Side Elevations; A702/PL04 Rev D Proposed Rear and South Side Elevations; A702/PL05 Rev B Proposed Sections; A702/PL06 Rev B Proposed Roof and Garden Plan; A702/PL07 Rev C Existing and Proposed Street Elevations; A702/PL20 Casement Windows Joinery Details and Single Glazing; A702/PL21 Casement Windows Joinery Details with Double Glazing; A702/PL22 Hinged Doors Joinery Details with Double Glazing; A702/PL23 Crittal Doors with Double Glazing; A702/PL24 Rev A Balcony Balustrade Details; A702/PL26 Rev C Bicycle Store G1.2 Details; Heritage Statement and Design & Access Statement prepared by Alice Poole Architects dated August 2021.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless stated on the application form.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013). | The window/s inserted in the first floor and second floor side elevations shall be obscure glazed and non-opening (where openable parts less than 1.7m above floor) unless otherwise confirmed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard neighbouring amenity from light pollution in accordance with policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development (unless shown on plans listed within Condition 2) shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7A, 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | Suitable precautions must be undertaken to secure and protect all interior and exterior elements against accidental loss or damage during building work and no such elements may be disturbed or removed temporarily or permanently except as indicated on the approved drawings or with the prior written approval of the local planning authority.

Reason: To protect the architectural and historic fabric of this Listed Building, in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | Any damage to the building caused by or during the course of the carrying out of the work permitted shall be made good within 3 months of the completion of the development, in accordance with a specification agreed in writing with the Local Planning Authority.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021). | The replacement of any windows pertaining to the existing Listed Building shall incorporate materials and joinery details that match the existing windows.

Reason: To ensure that the development harmonises with the subject Listed Building, in accordance with policies 7.4 and 7B of the Adopted Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
